title: NYC Food Bank Ships 20,000 Meals to Puerto Rico
description:
(29 Sep 2017) The Food Bank For New York is shipping 26 pallets of food and supplies to Puerto Rico to help in recovery after Hurricane Maria devastated the island last week.
"Today's truck held about 20,000 meals," Margarette Purvis, CEO of the Food Bank For New York City, consisting of peanut butter, cereal and diapers.
Purvis urged people wishing to donate not to send clothes.
"We need meals that are ready to eat," Purvis said, "that do not require heating like tuna, peanut butter just things that you can eat right away." 
The supplies are being sent directly to Puerto Rico for distribution by Banco de Alimentos de Puerto Rico, a sister organization on the island, to be distributed to victims of Hurricane Maria.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/420a8d22595c2b2f6d727fa20748a2a6
